title: Shops and Shopping
summary: Words and phrases related to different types of shops, shopping experiences, and common shopping interactions.

sections.heading: Introduction
sections.content: In this lesson, you will learn different words and phrases related to shops and shopping. Check the following pictures and look at the descriptions and sentence examples below.

sections.heading: Places for shopping
sections.content: There are many places we can go to when we want to do some shopping. Here is a list of some of the most common ones.

examples.example: There's a shop opposite my office that sells shoes and bags.
I entered the department store and went up to the men's clothing section.
All the fruit and vegetables in the supermarket were very expensive.
There are 80 shops and 9 restaurants in the new shopping centre.
I buy my vegetables from the outdoor market in the town square.

sections.heading: In a shop
sections.content: Common terms used when inside a shop or store.

examples.example: The customer paid the cashier for her tomatoes.
The customer paid the cashier for her tomatoes.
After I paid the cashier, he put the money in the cash register.
Darling, can you ask the sales assistant if they have this in a smaller size?
The shop was having a sale. Everything was 50% off.
There is a 25% discount on all books until the end of the month.
The price of the items is always written on your receipt.
The price of the items is always written on your receipt.
You will only get a refund if you show the cashier your receipt.
Before I purchased the dress, I tried it on in the fitting room.
Before I purchased the dress, I tried it on in the fitting room.
Before I purchased the dress, I tried it on in the fitting room.
Do you want to go to the shopping centre and do some window shopping?
Sorry, you can't pay in cash. We only accept cards.
I wanted to buy that new toy, but it's already sold out.

sections.heading: Useful language when you go shopping
sections.content: Common phrases used in shopping situations, especially for clothes.

subsections.heading: Things a shop assistant or cashier would say

examples.phrase: Are you paying in cash or by card?

sections.heading: Flashcards
sections.content: After completing the exercises in this lesson on Shops and Shopping, you can use the unit's Vocabulary Flashcards to revise and help you memorize the terms.
